intro: Psephellus fajvuschii, commonly known as the Fajvuschen's rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a shrub characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
